Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on the Effects of Unloader Knee Braces on Tibiofemoral Joint Loading

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to varus, valgus, or no brace conditions.

Participants.evidence: 20 healthy participants (mean age 28.3 years; BMI 22.9 kg/m²) with normal knee alignment were recruited.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to varus, valgus, or no brace conditions.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the impact of varus and valgus adjustments on knee joint loading and muscle activation.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the knee adduction moment, assessed during gait analysis over a specified timeframe.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation concealment was ensured.

Blinding.evidence: Outcome assessors were blinded to group assignments.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 20 healthy participants (mean age 28.3 years; BMI 22.9 kg/m²) with normal knee alignment were recruited.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Despite the lack of statistical significance, the observed effect sizes were moderate to large, suggesting the potential for further investigation.

Harms.evidence: No adverse events were reported during the study.
